titles.title: A resolution instructing the managers on the part of the Senate on the bill S. 1790 (116th Congress) to insist upon the members of the conference to consider potential commonsense solutions regarding family and medical leave, including voluntary compensatory time programs and incentives through the tax code.

A resolution instructing the managers on the part of the Senate on the bill S. 1790 (116th Congress) to insist upon the members of the conference to consider potential commonsense solutions regarding family and medical leave, including voluntary compensatory time programs and incentives through the tax code.

action.text: Measure laid before Senate by unanimous consent.

vote.text: Resolution agreed to in Senate without amendment by Yea-Nay Vote. 55 - 39. Record Vote Number: 307.
